Package com.briansanchez.blackjack

Class Player

java.lang.Object
com.briansanchez.blackjack.Player
Direct Known Subclasses:
Dealer
public class Player
extends Object
Implements a blackjack player, storing the current hand of cards, its value and determines whether the player has busted.
Author:
Brian Sanchez

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    protected boolean busted
    True indicates that the value of the player's hand is greater than 21
    protected ArrayList hand
    Internal representation of the player's current hand of cards
    protected boolean hitMe
    True indicates that the player will draw another card on the next turn, that is, the player will hit.
    protected int score
    Total score of the player's current hand
    protected Shoe shoe
    A reference to the shoe, a collection of cards from which players will be dealt
    protected static TreeMap winStats
    Stores the count of wins indexed by the value of the winning hand
    protected boolean won
    True indicates that the player has won this hand

    Provides access to the player win statistics
    boolean isBusted()
    Returns true if the value of the player's hand is greater than 21
    boolean isHitMe()
    Returns true if the player will hit on the next turn
    boolean isWon()
    Returns the player win status for this hand
    void newHand()
    Creates a new, empty hand for the player
    void setHitMe()
    Determines whether the player will hit on the next turn.
    void setWon()
    Updates the player win statistics
    String toString()
    Returns a beautified String describing the player's hand

      public boolean isBusted()
      Returns true if the value of the player's hand is greater than 21
      Returns:
      true if the player has busted, meaning the value of the player's hand is greater than Constants.WIN_VALUE

      TreeMap containing the win count indexed by the hand score
